posts.name: Debbie Bernier
posts.cooked:
Has anyone had any problem with inputting data with shuffleboard recently? We have a simple program which runs a motor. It‚Äôs controlled by buttons and user entry on Shuffleboard.  We have buttons to increment / decrement the voltage and also a user entry field to type in a voltage.  Plus we display the output voltage.

This past week, those buttons/fields stopped working. Clicking on them does nothing. I can‚Äôt enter data into the voltage field. The mouse cursor randomly changes to an up/down arrow or left/right arrow as if it thinks I‚Äôm trying to stretch the widgets.

I brought up Elastic and the buttons all work correctly. In fact with Shuffleboard and Elastic both running I can input voltage with Elastic and see the output voltage on both Elastic and Shuffleboard.

We are running with WPI 2025.2.1. We‚Äôve duplicated the problem on multiple laptops.

If anyone is interested, the code is in our repo . The project is in a subfolder called Basic Motor Control.

link_counts.title: GitHub - Team-Voltage-386/Software-Projects-Beginner: Projects for beginner software team members to tackle!
Publishing data to NT from Shuffleboard widget

posts.name: Tom Winter
posts.cooked: Yes, our kToggleButton buttons on Shuffleboard no longer work either.  The same code that worked for 2024 does not work for 2025.  The issue is that the getBoolean() method of the GenericEntry always returns the default value, regardless of the state of the button.

posts.name: Tom Winter
posts.cooked: I should add that it did not work for 2025.1.1 and the 2025.2.1 update did not fix the problem.  I have been meaning to create a simple test case to prove this and to report a bug, but have not done that yet.

posts.name: Alexander Carlisi
posts.cooked:
I went to test this, but It works for me, perhaps I‚Äôm missing something?

Edit: Sorry i miss understood. Shuffleboard is totally broken, Elastic does work though, proving its a Shuffleboard issue.
Shuffleboard has been effectively unmaintained for a while now and you should avoid using it in the future. For now, use either Elastic or QFRCDashboard .

posts.name: Paul Rensing
posts.cooked:
We are having the same problem. It connects to the Rio, sees value changes, but does not send any updates that are made locally.

Shuffleboard 2024 seems to work fine.

@Peter_Johnson I know it is somewhat orphaned, but if it‚Äôs not going to be fixed‚Ä¶

As always, I appreciate all the work put into WPILIB.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: We‚Äôre aware of the issue thanks to this thread, but I don‚Äôt have a timeline on fixing it.

posts.name: pryland
posts.cooked: Trying to utilize Elastic and/or Smartdashboard and evidently I‚Äôm making a stupid mistake.  Working with Krakens and trying to update PID ‚Äôs on the fly.  Whenever I make a change and press tab or click on another entry, the code reboots.

posts.name: Dan Katzuv
posts.cooked: The code probably crashes. Can you see if there‚Äôs a stack trace and paste it here? Also, a small suggestion for the code if I may, you can call apply in the first if statement unless I miss something.

posts.name: pryland
Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Just an update because this thread may pop up on searches: this issue was fixed in the 2025.3.1 version by reverting to the 2024 implementation.
